item.title: Massive IPTV piracy service with 28,000 channels taken offline
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment (ACE) announced the shutdown of Rare Breed TV, a major illegal IPTV service provider, after reaching a financial settlement with its operators. [...]

item.title: Air France and KLM disclose data breaches impacting customers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Air France and KLM announced on Wednesday that attackers had breached a customer service platform and stolen the data of an undisclosed number of customers. [...]

item.title: Microsoft warns of high-severity flaw in hybrid Exchange deployments
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has warned customers to mitigate a high-severity vulnerability in Exchange Server hybrid deployments that could allow attackers to escalate privileges in Exchange Online cloud environments undetected. [...]

item.title: Microsoft accidentally confirms GPT-5, GPT-5-Mini, GPT-5-Nano ahead of launch
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is hosting a live stream at 10AM PT to announce GPT-5, but Microsoft has already confirmed the details. [...]

item.title: Akira ransomware abuses CPU tuning tool to disable Microsoft Defender
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Akira ransomware is abusing a legitimate Intel CPU tuning driver to turn off Microsoft Defender in attacks from security tools and EDRs running on target machines. [...]

item.title: New Ghost Calls tactic abuses Zoom and Microsoft Teams for C2 operations
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new post-exploitation command-and-control (C2) evasion method called 'Ghost Calls' abuses TURN servers used by conferencing apps like Zoom and Microsoft Teams to tunnel traffic through trusted infrastructure. [...]

item.title: Hacker extradited to US for stealing $3.3 million from taxpayers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Nigerian national Chukwuemeka Victor Amachukwu has been extradited from France to the U.S. to face charges of hacking, fraud, and identity theft for suspected spearphishing attacks on U.S. tax preparation businesses. [...]

item.title: MFA matters… But it isn’t enough on its own
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: MFA blocks 99% of attacks—but weak passwords still let attackers in. Specops helps you enforce strong password policies and MFA everywhere, so one layer doesn't undo the other. Book your free trial today. [...]

item.title: Google suffers data breach in ongoing Salesforce data theft attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google is the latest company to suffer a data breach in an ongoing wave of Salesforce CRM data theft attacks conducted by the ShinyHunters extortion group. [...]

item.title: National Bank of Canada online systems down due to 'technical issue'
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: National Bank of Canada (Banque Nationale du Canada), the sixth largest commercial bank of Canada is currently experiencing a widespread service outage affecting its online banking and mobile app platforms. [...]

item.title: ReVault flaws let hackers bypass Windows login on Dell laptops
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ControlVault3 firmware vulnerabilities impacting over 100 Dell laptop models can allow attackers to bypass Windows login and install malware that persists across system reinstalls. [...]

item.title: WhatsApp adds new security feature to protect against scams
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: WhatsApp is introducing a new security feature that will help users spot potential scams when they are being added to a group chat by someone not in their contact list. [...]

item.title: Trend Micro warns of Apex One zero-day exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Trend Micro has warned customers to immediately secure their systems against an actively exploited remote code execution vulnerability in its Apex One endpoint security platform. [...]
